item.title: Commercial rubbish bins left on street, 5th January
item.description:
The top of Hazelwood Lane has become a centre for fly tipping. The black bins that belong to the flats are now (apparently) going to be emptied daily but now two commercial rubbish bins have been left in the same spot which is encouraging yet more fly tipping. These bins should be behind the shops but the company emptying them are now leaving them on the pavement next to the problematic black bins. Bin Bags are broken open by foxes and there is frequently litter everywhere. It is a health hazard as well as being unsightly and causing a mess.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazelwood Lane, Palmers Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice on Road outside school, 5th January
item.description:
The road has black ice causing cars to skid down the road. This is highly dangerous as the children go back to school tomorrow. This will in danger the lives of the children.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Hill Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins, 5th January
item.description:
This is a recurring problem. The house with 4 flats only has one bin, it fills up very quickly and then overflows. Foxes then spread the waste across Deronda road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Deronda Road, Tulse Hill, Greater London

item.title: Dead Fox and huge amount of Fly Tipping, 5th January
item.description:
Been there for days and everyone I walk past more stuff added like food, furniture, bin bags etc. Dead Fox decomposing and not a nice sight. All of Samuel street (especially near the Surgery) needs a look at

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Samuel Street, Woolwich

item.title: Large quantity of fly tipped rubbish dumped by the litter Franks Park near the Halt Robin Road Belvedere DA17 entrance, 5th January
item.description:
A large quantity of fly tipped rubbish in black sacks & other waste has been dumped by the litter bin in Franks Park near the entrance of Halt Robin Road Belvedere DA17, almost opposite its junction with Gladeswood Road. Would arrangements be put in place to remove the rubbish as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halt Robin Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Car alarm going off for days, 5th January
item.description:
Car left throughout year for days at a time with alarm going off. The owner does not car that itâ€™s outside my house and various neighbours have also appealed for the car to not be parked here or to fix the alarm. Lat time was 7th December, then Wednesday 31st to 4th Jan, and back again today.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eliot Bank, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brickwork left on pavement following damage to wall, 5th January
item.description:
Bricks left on pavement for a number of weeks following damage to front boundry wall. Owners of property do not appear to be inclined to remove their brick rubble.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Leyland Avenue, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin, 5th January
item.description:
The litter bins on The Gun Site on Jubilee Country Park had clearly not been emptied over the weekend. There were dog poo bags, coffee cups and other rubbish strewn all over the ground. The Friends of Jubilee Country Park collected all the litter beyond the bins. There is clearly an issue with whoever is supposed to empty the bins at weekends because on weekdays they are always properly emptied.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merton Gardens, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
